title: William Robinson (boxer)
text:
William Robinson (born 20 February 1936) is a British <a href="boxing">boxer</a> and fought as Bill Robinson. He competed in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201964%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Light%20middleweight">men's light middleweight</a> event at the <a href="1964%20Summer%20Olympics">1964 Summer Olympics</a>. He received a bye in the first round, before being defeated by <a href="Nojim%20Maiyegun">Nojim Maiyegun</a> of Nigeria in the next round, after the referee stopped the contest.
Robinson won the 1964 <a href="England%20Boxing">Amateur Boxing Association</a> British <a href="England%20Boxing%20National%20Amateur%20Championships%20Light-Middleweight%20Champions">light-middleweight title</a> and 1965 British <a href="England%20Boxing%20National%20Amateur%20Championships%20Middleweight%20Champions">middleweight title</a>, when boxing out of the Stock Exchange ABC.
